original: Björk, Nils Axel Hjalmar, överste, Skövde, f. 25/2/98 i Västerås av Axel B. o. h. h. f. Nilsson. G. 22 m. Margit Borgman. Barn: Barbro, g. m. löjtn. G. Olsson, Boden, Hervor, g. m. löjtn. H. Waldner, Boden. — Stud:-ex. i Västerås 16, off :ex. 18. Fänr. v. Västmanl. reg. 18, löjtn. 20, v. Västern. reg. 28, kapt. v. gen:stab. 31, v. Svea livg. 37, major i armén 38, v. gen :is’tabskår. 38, öv:löjtn. 41, överste o. chef f. Norrb. reg. 42, överste v. pans:trupp. o. chef f. Skarab. pans:-reg. 46. Avd:chef v. försv:stab. ar-méop:avd. 38-42, chef f. evak:stab. v. evakuer. fr. norra Finl. 44. Mil. sakk. i 30 års försv:komm. 33-36, led. av komm. f. utredn. om hemv. 40, repr. f. försv:väs. i öv:styr. f. SvRK 39-42. Skr.: Tre nord. försv :problem (38). Hobby: filateli. KS02kl, KV02kl, RNO, LKrVA, KFinlVRO, FFrK-3 kl m. sv, SvRK ftj:M, Bef :utb :förb. ftj:SM, Norrb. bef :utb :förb. ftj :GM, Finl. befolkn:sk. ftj:M.
translated: Björk, Nils Axel Hjalmar, Colonel, Skövde, born February 25, 1898 in Västerås to Axel B. and his wife H. H. F. Nilsson. Married in 1922 to Margit Borgman, they had two children: Barbro, who married Lieutenant G. Olsson of Boden, and Hervor, who married Lieutenant H. Waldner of Boden. Björk passed his studentexamen (secondary school leaving certificate) in Västerås in 1916 and his officersexamen (military officer exam) in 1918. He served as a second lieutenant in the Västmanland Regiment in 1918, as a lieutenant in the Västernorrland Regiment in 1920, and as a captain in the General Staff in 1931. He was a major in the army in 1938, served in the General Staff Corps in 1938, became a lieutenant colonel in 1941, and was the colonel and chief of the Norrbotten Regiment in 1942. He was then the colonel and chief of the Skaraborg Armoured Regiment in 1946. Björk was also the head of the army's evacuation staff from 1938 to 1942, and head of the evacuation staff during the evacuation from northern Finland in 1944. He was a military expert in the Commission for 30 years of defense (1933-1936), a member of the Commission investigating home defense (1940), and a representative for defense equipment in the supreme command for the Swedish Red Cross (1939-1942). He wrote "Three Nordic Defense Problems" in 1938 and his hobby was philately. He was awarded the Order of the Polar Star with Commander's Cross, Knight of the Victoria Order, the Commander's Cross of the French Legion of Honour, and the Swedish Red Cross merit badge. Björk was a member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences and received the Medal of Instruction for Teachers in the Armed Forces and the Norrbotten Medal of Instruction for Teachers in the Armed Forces. He was also a member of the Finnish People's Red Cross merit badge.

structured.description: Nils Axel Hjalmar Björk was a Swedish military officer, writer, and expert on defense. He served in various capacities in the Swedish Army, including as colonel and chief of the Norrbotten Regiment and the Skaraborg Armoured Regiment. Björk was also head of the army's evacuation staff during World War II and wrote about defense in his book 'Three Nordic Defense Problems.' In addition to his military career, he was also a philatelist. He received several awards and honors for his work in the military and was a member of the Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences and the Swedish Red Cross.
